options.name: Enlighteners
options.description: The Vethi culture shares a special relationship with all living things and find their purpose in the wilds. Gain +1 Animals and +1 Wilderness.

options.name: Rune Masters
options.description: Many of those within the Vethi culture are taught at a young age to runecarve. Gain +1 Runecarving and learn 1 Magical Language.

options.name: Burden of the Ancestors
options.description: Many within the Vethi culture are taught focus and inward dialog so that they do not repeat the crimes of those who came before. You gain +1 Concentration and +1 Insight.

options.name: Reaction [Daily] : Antimagic
options.description: In response to a Spell being Channeled within a number of Units equal to your Level, lower the Spell Attack by 1d8. If the Spell does not require a Spell Attack, the Spell fails if the result of the d8 is 6 or higher.

options.name: Abstained Magic
options.description: There are several groups within the Vethi culture that villify the use of Magic and train to resit its effects. You have a -1 Penalty to Spell Attack but gain +4 Arcane and +4 Psychic Mitigation.

options.name: Embraced Magic
options.description: There are several groups within the Vethi culture that want to reclaim the old ways. Gain +1 Spell Attack and +1 Spell Damage but suffer a -2 Penalty to Arcane and Pyschic Mitigation.

options.name: Ultimate Focus
options.description: Those with great promise are taught the ancient ways of the Vethi and can split their thought into multiple strands. You are able to Focus on two things at once, though Concentration Checks you make have a 1d4 Penalty when using this ability.
